link.title: Round Trips to Authenticate a MongoDB Client Connection

entry.summary: When MongoDB Drivers establish a connection with a MongoDB cluster a number of network round trips (RTT) are performed. This can result in increased latency when measuring the time to response of an operation following a cold start, so it’s worth understanding what the anatomy of an authenticated connection is - as well as what can be done to improve performance by reducing total RTTs.
